item.title: Carloop Not Communicating with Vehicle‚Äôs OBD-II Port
item.dc:creator: keral
item.description:
Hello

I recently set up my Carloop device and followed the initial setup guide; but I‚Äôm having trouble getting it to communicate with my vehicle‚Äôs OBD-II port.

The device powers on correctly when plugged in, and I can connect it to my computer, but I‚Äôm not receiving any data from the car‚Äôs ECU. I‚Äôve tried using different vehicles to rule out compatibility issues, but the problem persists.

I have double-checked my connections and verified that the CAN library is correctly installed. I‚Äôve also attempted to send basic requests to the OBD-II system but am not getting any response. Could this be due to specific vehicle manufacturer restrictions / is there a common troubleshooting step I might be missing? I have checked Getting Started - Carloop Community Azure guide for reference .

Has anyone else encountered this issue when getting started with Carloop? I‚Äôd appreciate any advice on debugging this connection issue and ensuring that my setup is correctly configured.

Thanks in advance!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Carloop Not Communicating with Vehicle‚Äôs OBD-II Port

item.title: How to Configure AWS Big Data with My Volkswagen Atlas?
item.dc:creator: halcyoncv
item.description:
Hey everyone,

I am diving into a new project where I am trying to set up my Volkswagen Atlas (2019 model) to send data directly to AWS for storage and analysis. As I have seen many people using this in my surrounding. I‚Äôve got Carloop up and running, and now I am looking to leverage AWS Big Data tools to collect and analyze all the information from my car.

I was doing research about the same I came across these resources/articles Volkswagen Group iSI Case Study | IoT | AWS what is AWS big data?, however, they are information but I wanted to learn from community members.

Has anyone here done something similar? I‚Äôm particularly interested in any tips on configuring the data pipeline from Carloop to AWS, and what services you‚Äôd recommend for real-time processing and long-term storage. Any pitfalls to avoid or best practices to follow would be awesome to know.

Thanks in advance for the help!

Best Regards,

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: How to Configure AWS Big Data with My Volkswagen Atlas?

item.title: Help Needed with Setting Up Carloop GPS on My Vehicle
item.dc:creator: shawn5670
item.description:
Hello guys!

I am trying to get my Carloop GPS up and running in my car, but I‚Äôm stuck! No matter what I try, I can‚Äôt seem to get a signal.

Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve done so far:

  • Plugged the Carloop thingy (is that what it‚Äôs called?) into the OBD-II port in my car.
  • Downloaded the Carloop library onto my Particle device (hope I did that right!).
  • Uploaded the sample GPS code to the device (fingers crossed!).
  • Checked the Particle console for GPS info, but it‚Äôs blank.
  • Double-checked everything, and the device seems connected, but the GPS data is missing in action.

I also check this: https://carloop.dyndns.org/t/help-with-carloop-code-reader-appsalesforce-dev But I have not found any solution. Anyone else ever face this issue? Maybe I‚Äôm missing something super simple? Any troubleshooting tips from the experts would be a lifesaver!

Thanks in advance

Respected community member

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Help Needed with Setting Up Carloop GPS on My Vehicle

item.title: Troubleshooting Stepper Motor Issues with Blackbox X32 in CNC Setup
item.dc:creator: shawn5670
item.description:
Hi everyone,

I was recently working on a CNC project and using a Blackbox X32 controller along with Nema 23 stepper motors. I‚Äôm experiencing some issues with the setup and could use some advice from those who have experience with similar configurations.
Here are the specifics of my setup:

  • Blackbox X32 controller
  • Nema 23 stepper motors

But I am facing some specific issues like:

  1. Sometimes the motors skip steps or move erratically.
  2. The motors and controller seem to get quite hot after a short period of operation.
  3. There‚Äôs a lot of noise from the motors during operation, which I suspect might be due to improper tuning.

I have tried adjusting the current settings on the Blackbox X32 and checking all connections, but the problems persist. Has anyone else encountered similar issues or have any tips on how to resolve them? Are there specific settings or configurations I should be aware of for this setup?

Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Troubleshooting Stepper Motor Issues with Blackbox X32 in CNC Setup

item.title: Communicating to ECU problem
item.dc:creator: ehsan
item.description:
hello every one
i have ECU model : siemens continental SIM2K-34VR
and i want to communicate to it by can protocol i have sent this pid request :
txHeader.DLC = 3;
txHeader.IDE = CAN_ID_STD;
txHeader.StdId = 0x7DF;

TxMessage.data[0] = 0x02;
TxMessage.data[1] = 0x01;
TxMessage.data[2] = 0x00;
TxMessage.data[3] = 0x00;
TxMessage.data[4] = 0x00;
TxMessage.data[5] = 0x00;
TxMessage.data[6] = 0x00;
TxMessage.data[7] = 0x00;

but the received can message is this :
ID: 0x1C3
Rx: 0x00 0x00 0x0D 0x08 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00

i haven‚Äôt connect anything else to ECU just +12V and GND and SWITCH power
is it because of this ?or sth else?

how can i found the standard iso of my ECU i search all around the internet but didn‚Äôt get anything usefull

appreciate your help.

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Communicating to ECU problem

item.title: Carloop is Retired
item.dc:creator: jvanier
item.description:
Back in 2016, we introduced Carloop, a 100% open-source development kit designed to connect cars to the cloud, supporting applications like GPS tracking, mileage logging, and diagnostic trouble code decoding. Since then, a vibrant community of passionate developers and enthusiasts came on a journey with us to open the secrets of modern cars.

This journey is coming to an end. We are retiring the Carloop hardware. Rest assured that your existing hardware will continue working.

The last Carloop units are available for a fire sale at https://store.carloop.io while supplies last.

We will also keep this forum and our GitHub repository at Carloop ¬∑ GitHub active as a sign of our commitment to the community. As passionate hackers, we encourage you to connect with us on LinkedIn or X (Formerly Twitter).

‚Äî Alan Mond & Julien Vanier, the Carloop team
LinkedIn: Alan, Julien. X (formerly Twitter): Alan, Julien.

2 posts - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Carloop is Retired

item.title: Which CANbus avail at OBD2 connector 2009 Honda
item.dc:creator: ohseegee
item.description:
I want to receive/transmit lock and unlock codes to my 2009 Honda Accord.

I have plugged into the CANbus at the OBD2 connector and am successfully reading CAN frames. However, I‚Äôm not capturing any lock/lock codes.

I read on this post that there are 2 CAN busses on the Honda‚Äôs, bridged through a gateway module. SO my questions are:

  1. Which CAN bus (F or B) am I connecting to at the OBD2 connector? Since my speed is 500k on the bus I assume F.
  2. How can I ask the gateway to bridge lock codes (send and receive) across the busses?
  3. If #2 is not possible, how can I (easily) connect to the CAN-B on this car? I say in the other post that an Odysey owner jumpered into CAN-B at a car heater module‚Ä¶but hoping for something easier or under-dash.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Which CANbus avail at OBD2 connector 2009 Honda

item.title: Beginner Carloop Pro Owner, GPS Functionality Questions!
item.dc:creator: zanie
item.description:
Hello all!

I am very excited to finally have my very own carloop pro! I have been very anxious and before receiving the product, have been nose-deep in documentation and further functionalities.

When setting up my device, I have 1) connected the device to my desktop via the mini-usb port thats located near the beige port on the top side, 2) inserted sim card and activated sim card on console.partcle.io , 3) connected the antenna cable as well, made sure it snapped into place.

I am now only seeing a constant flash of green LED and a solid red LED along with a short white pulse which immediately returns to its original green and red.

I have read many articles stating that it can take anywhere from seconds to minutes for configuration which is why I waited so long to make a post on this forum page,

On https://docs.particle.io/troubleshooting/led/electron/ , it states that this pattern I am seeing is the normal one after powering on but it has been connected for 45+ minutes now with no change.

Side Note: is this problem being caused by lack of power of the GPS module itself which is the beige port that i mentioned before?

I intend to work on a 2015 Lexus is250 F Sport, its my daily for now / soon to be track - only car. I am also in my final year of University and plan on making a mini ‚Äòtune‚Äô file for the car for my Senior Project as I am a computer science major. With green flag‚Äôs from advisors and professors, I am very eager to jump into this project as soon as possible and learn as much as I can!

Any and all help would be greatly appreciated!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Beginner Carloop Pro Owner, GPS Functionality Questions!

item.title: Having trouble getting candump to show meaningfull data
item.dc:creator: wustlStudent
item.description:
On a 2017 Rav4 and a 2019 Volkswagen Golf, I have not been able to get meaningful candump data. I essentially get no data.

I‚Äôm using a virtualbox ubuntu image on a windows 10 pc. I pass through the USB.

I run
sudo apt install can-utils
sudo slcand -o -c -s6 /dev/ttyACM0 can0
sudo ifconfig can0 up txqueuelen 1000
candump can0

The final command simply prints out one message over and over again.

What am I missing?

I‚Äôm definitely getting some pid info using the the visualization sample app: Visualize Car Data With Carloop And Blynk - Hackster.io

But I haven‚Äôt been able to get onto the can bus and start sniffing and spoofing, as I want to. Shouldn‚Äôt the CAN network be on the OBDII port and thus the carloop, or are there deeper electronics that I‚Äôm missing?

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Having trouble getting candump to show meaningfull data

void setup() {

carloop.setCANSpeed(500000);
carloop.begin();

item.title: Master's thesis project ideas/guidance
item.dc:creator: alright21
item.description:
Hello everyone! My name is Alberto and I am a Master‚Äôs degree student in Cyber Security who is currently looking for project ideas that can be translated to an master‚Äôs thesis.
I recently got interested in Automotive Security thanks to a company I discussed with. I had the opportunity to read the recent standards in the field (ISO 21434, UNECE WP.29, ‚Ä¶) but I do not have much experience in the practical side of car security and testing, so I am here to ask for a little help. If you have some ideas you want to share, or if you are working in some projects I could help with, feel free to post it below, so we can start an interesting conversation.
I graduated in computer science and I learned by myself concept of offensive security and penetration testing, but I am far from an expert in this field, so I am always trying to expand my knowledge and learn more. I found out that car security is an interesting area to study and to work on, so I decided to focus on that for my final project.
Thank you in advance for your time and I am happy to hear what you are working on/what you want to share.
Stay safe!

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Master's thesis project ideas/guidance

item.title: Carloop as Poor man's Passthrough-Device
item.dc:creator: DrMickeyLauer
item.description:
Hi from Germany,

I‚Äôm working on OBD2 and UDS Apps for iOS. To facilitate reprogramming, I have looked out for a
proper device that allows me to connect via WiFi or BLE and send and receive CAN frames.

I don‚Äôt want or need any ELM327 or STN compatibility, I‚Äôm rather leaning towards a simple WiFi-interface
that allows me to send and receive unprocessed frames in the fastest and simplest way.

For this I would need the Carloop to act as a WiFi access point, offering a simple TCP-interface
that translates my commands and sends them to CAN, receiving the answers and piping them back via WiFi.

The icing on the cake would be automatic CAN frame segmentation and perhaps ISO-TP encoding/decoding.

Is this possible with the CarLoop Photon or did I buy something wrong?
Moreover, did any one do something like this where I could join forces?

Best regards,

Mickey.

4 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Carloop as Poor man's Passthrough-Device

item.title: Carloop Basic USB device not detected on Windows or Linux
item.dc:creator: dreolf
item.description:
I‚Äôm having some trouble accessing the USB interface on my Carloop Basic. I‚Äôve initialized and registered the Photon and upgraded its firmware, all over wifi. But when I attach it to a USB 2 or 3 port, I don‚Äôt see the Carloop as a USB device. I‚Äôve tried it natively on three Windows 10 devices with both USB 3 and 2, one Windows 7 computer with USB 2 and a Ubuntil 20.0.04L laptop with USB 2. In all cases, the Photon USB connection is not detected in or out of DFU mode. ‚Äúdfu-util -l‚Äù sees nothing, nor does ‚Äúparticle usb list‚Äù. USB drivers are installed. I have no trouble accessing the Photon using wifi (‚Äúparticle list‚Äù works fine). Anybody out there run into this and found a solution? Hard to believe I have a defective USB interface on the Photon but suppose it‚Äôs possible.

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Carloop Basic USB device not detected on Windows or Linux

item.title: Hardware assembly and github code configration
item.dc:creator: Odb7
item.description:
Hello, I wanted to buy the basic but they are sold out So my next best option is buy carloop without the photon. I already have the photon and know how to download and extract the github code
How long does it take to configure the Carloop to get it all up and running? Is there a video or tutorial on it. I was not able to find anything here Getting Started with Carloop Is is possible to download a third-party App from Apple Store that does OBD2 scanning as the one on the https://www.carloop.io/apps/ are very basic like mileage reader and code scanner

Here is what I am looking for in a ODB2 scanner

  1. Read diagnostic trouble codes, both generic and manufacturer-specific, and display their meaning (over 3000 generic code definitions in the database).
  2. Clear trouble codes and turn off the MIL (‚ÄúCheck Engine‚Äù light)
  3. Display current sensor data, including:
  4. Engine RPM
  5. Calculated Load Value
  6. Coolant Temperature
  7. Fuel System Status
  8. Vehicle Speed
  9. Short Term Fuel Trim
  10. Long Term Fuel Trim
  11. Intake Manifold Pressure
  12. Timing Advance
  13. Intake Air Temperature
  14. Air Flow Rate
  15. Absolute Throttle Position
  16. Oxygen sensor voltages/associated short term fuel trims
  17. Fuel System status
  18. Fuel Pressure

And save that on an SD Card in CSV format
And I have Kia Rio 2002 Model so not all Hardware in the Market support it

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic
item.source: Hardware assembly and github code configration
